text.section: In this title the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Commission" includes a historic district commission or a historic preservation commission.

"Demolition" includes any willful neglect in the maintenance and repair of a structure, other than the appurtenance and environmental setting of the structure, that:
is not due to a financial inability to maintain and repair the structure; and
threatens to result in a substantial deterioration of the exterior features of the structure.
"District" means a significant concentration, linkage, or continuity of sites, structures, or objects united historically or aesthetically by plan or development.
"Person" includes a unit of local government.

"Routine maintenance" means work that:
does not alter the exterior fabric or features of a site or structure; and
has no material effect on the historical, archaeological, or architectural significance of the site or structure.

"Site" means the location of:
an event of historic significance; or
a structure or ruin that possesses historic, archaeological, or cultural significance.

section.section: "Structure" means a combination of material to form a construction that is stable.
